case_information.incident_description: Laptop computer stolen from office building

timeline.14:00: Building security confirms normal access patterns
timeline.14:15: Victim last seen laptop on desk

physical_evidence: Security camera footage shows suspect entering floor at 14:35
Key card access log shows unauthorized entry to Room 512 at 14:37
Fingerprints found on victim's desk drawer

witnesses.name: Mike Chen
witnesses.statement: Saw suspect near victim's office around 2:30 PM

witnesses.name: Security Guard Roberts
witnesses.statement: Noticed suspect acting nervous near elevators

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: Alex, thank you for coming in today. I want to talk to you about what happened at Tech Corp yesterday. Can you tell me where you were between 2 PM and 4 PM?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: I was working on the network maintenance project. I think I was mostly in the server room on the 3rd floor.

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: You think? Can you be more specific about your location and activities?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: Well, I definitely was on the 3rd floor. I was running cable diagnostics and... uh... updating some software. I probably didn't leave that area all afternoon.

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: We have key card records showing access to the 5th floor at 2:37 PM. Can you explain that?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: Oh, the 5th floor? I... I might have gone up there briefly. Sometimes I need to check network connections on different floors. But I wasn't there long.

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: Specifically, your card accessed Room 512. Do you know Sarah Johnson?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: Sarah? Yeah, I know who she is. But I would never go into someone's office without permission. Maybe there was a mistake with the card reader?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: The system is quite accurate. What were you doing in Room 512?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: I honestly don't remember being in that specific room. I mean, I might have poked my head in to check a network port, but I definitely didn't touch anything that wasn't mine.

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: A laptop was stolen from that room. A very expensive MacBook Pro. Do you know anything about that?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: A laptop was stolen? That's terrible! But I had nothing to do with that. I would never steal anything, especially not from someone I work with.

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: We have a witness who saw you near Sarah's office around 2:30 PM, looking nervous.

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: Nervous? I wasn't nervous. I was just focused on my work. Maybe I looked concentrated, but definitely not nervous. Who said I looked nervous?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: Can anyone verify where you were during the time in question?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: I was mostly working alone. But my supervisor, Tom, might have seen me around. And I think I talked to someone from maintenance, but I can't remember exactly when.

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: You mentioned you were on the 3rd floor, but now you're not sure about the timing of your conversations. Can you walk me through your afternoon more carefully?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: Look, I'm trying to be helpful here, but yesterday was busy and I had a lot on my mind. My contract is ending this week, so I've been stressed about finding new work. Maybe I'm not remembering everything perfectly.

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: I understand you're under stress. But it's important that you're accurate about your whereabouts. Do you have any receipts, parking tickets, or other documentation from yesterday afternoon?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: Documentation? I don't usually keep receipts for anything during work hours. I parked in the company garage, but I don't think they give tickets for that.

conversation_transcript.speaker: Detective
conversation_transcript.content: Alex, is there anything else you want to tell me about yesterday? Anything you might have forgotten or want to clarify?

conversation_transcript.speaker: Subject
conversation_transcript.content: I just want to be clear that I had nothing to do with any theft. I'm an honest person, and I would never jeopardize my career over something like that. If my card shows I was on the 5th floor, then maybe I was, but I certainly didn't steal anything.

deception_indicators_to_watch: Memory gaps or claims of poor recall
Changes in confidence level between statements
investigation_priorities: Verify supervisor and maintenance worker interactions
Review complete security footage from relevant times
Check if any network maintenance was actually scheduled
Examine subject's financial situation and job stress
